sentences.en: A seagull swooped down in front of her car, causing her to slam on the brakes.
sentences.cn: 一只海鸥突然扑到她的车前，她急忙猛踩刹车。

sentences.en: A small dog barked at a seagull he was chasing.
sentences.cn: 小狗对着它正在追赶的一只海鸥吠叫。

sentences.en: And today, if you go to Salt Lake City, you can see a monument with seagulls on top of it.
sentences.cn: 今天, 如果你去盐湖城, 你会看到有一座顶端雕刻有海鸥的纪念碑.

sentences.en: Seagulls followed in the wake of the huge ship.
Seagulls hover over the surging waves.
sentences.cn: 海鸥在惊涛骇浪上翱翔.

sentences.en: The cries of the seagulls gave this part of the harbour a fascinating character all of its own.
sentences.cn: 海鸥的鸣叫声给这片海港带来了迷人的独特气息。

sentences.en: The seagulls swirled in aerial combat over the barges.
sentences.cn: 海鸥盘旋在驳船上方，展开空中的搏斗。

sentences.en: The seagulls were wheeling in the air above me.
sentences.cn: 海鸥正在我的上空盘旋.

sentences.en: The seagulls were wheeling in the air above the ship.
The sky, deepening to ochre, is broken by two or three seagulls.
sentences.cn: 两点三点白鸥划破了渐变为赭色的天空.

sentences.en: There are few precedents for this sort of retroactive legislation.
sentences.cn: 这种有追溯力的法规鲜有先例。

sentences.en: There is a seagull perched atop the mast.
sentences.cn: 有一只海鸥停歇在桅杆上.

sentences.en: They lay on the firm sands, listening to the plaintive cry of the seagulls.
sentences.cn: 他们躺在硬实的沙地上，听着海鸥的哀鸣。

words.tran_cn: 追溯的；[法]有追溯效力的；反动的

trans.tran_cn: 反动的，追溯的，有追溯力的，从以往某天开始生效
trans.tran_en: a law or decision that is retroactive is effective from a particular date in the past
